news_header: Heavy rains in Missouri caused flooding and multiple rescue operations, resulting in at least five deaths.
news_text: In Missouri, 200 millimeters of rain fell in two days, leading to flooding and daily rescue operations. At least five people have died due to floods caused by the heavy rains. Wright County officials confirmed that the two fatalities were election officials. The National Weather Service warned that the storm could spawn tornadoes in Oklahoma and Arkansas, where no fatalities were reported.
